definitions.definition: A part of a larger whole, usually in such a form that it is able to be separated from other parts.
definitions.example: I’d like another piece of pie.

definitions.definition: A single item belonging to a class of similar items
One of the figures used in playing chess, specifically a higher-value figure as distinguished from a pawn; by extension, a similar counter etc. in other games.
A coin, especially one valued at less than the principal unit of currency.
An artistic creation, such as a painting, sculpture, musical composition, literary work, etc.
definitions.example: She played two beautiful pieces on the piano.

definitions.definition: An article published in the press.
definitions.example: Today's paper has an interesting piece on medical research.

definitions.definition: An artillery gun.
A gun.
(short for hairpiece) A toupee or wig, especially when worn by a man.
definitions.example: The announcer is wearing a new piece.

definitions.definition: A slice or other quantity of bread, eaten on its own; a sandwich or light snack.
A sexual encounter; from piece of ass or piece of tail
definitions.example: I got a piece at lunchtime.

definitions.definition: (mildly, short for piece of crap/piece of shit) A shoddy or worthless object (usually applied to consumer products like vehicles or appliances).
definitions.example: Ugh, my new computer is such a piece. I'm taking it back to the store tomorrow.

definitions.definition: A cannabis pipe.
Used to describe a pitch that has been hit but not well, usually either being caught by the opposing team or going foul. Usually used in the past tense with got.
definitions.example: he got a piece of that one;  she got a piece of the ball [...] and it's going foul.

definitions.definition: (sometimes derogatory) An individual; a person.
A castle; a fortified building.
A pacifier; a dummy.
A distance.
A structured practice row, often used for performance evaluation.
definitions.example: At practice we rowed four 5,000 meter pieces.

definitions.definition: An amount of work to be done at one time; a unit of piece work.
(usually with together) To assemble (something real or figurative).
definitions.example: These clues allowed us to piece together the solution to the mystery.

definitions.definition: To make, enlarge, or repair, by the addition of a piece or pieces; to patch; often with out.
To produce a work of graffiti more complex than a tag.
